radiographic_examinations.findings: Cystic structures around the bilateral lateral ventricles; abnormal signal foci in the white matter of the right parietal lobe; smaller diameters and sulci of the fetal brain than those of normal fetuses.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI at 28+1 weeks showed mild dilation of the bilateral ventricles and cystic structures around them; abnormal signal foci persisted in the white matter of the fetal right parietal lobe; smaller brain diameter and sulcus development compared to normal fetuses continued.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild dilation of the bilateral ventricles; cystic structures around them; abnormal signal foci in the white matter of the fetal right parietal lobe; smaller brain diameter and sulcus development than normal fetuses.
